top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

Spend a few minutes on [LibGen](https://libgen.is/). A file-sharing based shadow library website where you can download scholarly journal articles, academic and general-interest books, images, comics, audiobooks, and magazines. Free content in various formats (epub, pdf, doc, mobi, etc.)
Check out the library in your school.
Book publishers are scumbags. Calculus hasn't changed in 300 years but they will come out with a new edition every 2 years so they can switch the exercise numbers around and charge $250 again.

college libraries have textbooks and if they don't you can request them through interlibrary loan. so if you want to get a textbook it's pretty much impossible for you to not find it. you shouldn't ever pay for a textbook
